defs: a person who has a definite scheme or plan for making, doing or arranging something.
a good state of affairs.
the purpose of carrying out, accomplishing something.
ಕಾರ್ಯವಾಸಿ ಕತ್ತೆಕಾಲು ಕಟ್ಟು kāryavāsi kattekālu kaṭṭu to stoop humbly or debase oneself to get selfish motives achieved.
a man who has taken up the responsibility of doing, performing or achieving something.
a woman who has taken up the responsibility of doing, performing or achieving something.
carrying out duties, functions, etc. or managing affairs, as in a business organisation.
= ಕಾರ್ಯವಾಹಕ.
anything that hampers, hinders, impedes the work, task or function of a person; an impediment; an obstruction; a hindrance.
a plan of one's proposed action or action undertaken.
the act of dividing or sharing of labour among many (usu. to achieve better result utilising the skill, knowledge of all persons involved).
a man who accomplishes his work or duty efficiently or effectively.
a building, room, in which the affairs of a business, professional person or government or repairs, manufacturing, etc., are carried on; a workshop; an office.
a man who helps, assists another in carrying out some plan, work, etc. or carries out on another's behalf.
a woman who helps, assists another person in carrying out some plan, work, etc.; or carries out on another's behalf.
a committee, group of persons empowered and required to administer; an executive committee or board.
one who achieves, accomplishes (something, despite facing hurdles).
an instrument, agency, method or course of action, by which some object is or may be attained or some result is or may be brought about; means.
the act or fact of accomplishing something.
fulfilment, completion or consummation of something; accomplishment.
the act or fact of accomplishing, completing or fulfilling something; accomplishment.
a list or outline of things to be considered or done; a schedule of programmes; an agenda.
a person, group of people or branch of government empowered and required to administer the laws and affairs of a nation; the executive wing of a government.
a work, job or task different from the one undertaken or meant.
the intention or purpose of an act.
the judgement or discretion about what one does or must do, taking into consideration the positive and negative effects of such an action.
a room, building, etc., in which work (esp. manufacture) is carried on; a workplace.
a meeting or session for discussion, study, experiment, etc. in any field; a workshop.
an operation - a) the act, process or method of operating; b) any movement or series of movements made in accomplishing a mission or carrying out strategic military plans.
strong intensity of feeling in favour of doing something.
a man having strong intensity of feeling in favour of carrying out something.
a woman having a stong zeal to carry out something.
pertaining to execution of a work, task or job; putting into practice or related to implementation.
the intention, purpose or aim of an action.
with a purpose; intentionally; purposely.

an office - a) the building, room or rooms in which the affairs of a business, professional person, branch of government, political party, etc. are carried on; b) a chamber assighed to a specific person or a group of persons in such a place.
the period of light between sunrise and sunset of any solar day during rainy season.
a black track; a smoky way; the path of the Fire-God.
the Fire-God, whose path is characterised by smoke and blackness.
a robust, young horse.
a man whose traditional profession fishery or boatmanship.
Manmatha, whose bow is made of a sugar-cane.
an artificial waterway, esp. for irrigation; a canal.
a kind of oblong, red cloth for covering the head or shoulders; a red shawl.
(rhet.) one of the ten stages of agony of being separated from one's lover.
a silver coin of the weight of sixteen cowries.
a standard piece of a metal, of sixteen cowries, used on a balance or scale in weighing.
weighing or equal to the weight of sixteen cowries.
= ಕಾರ್ಷಾಪಣ - 1.
a person who earns a living by farming, esp., one who manages or operates a farm; a farmer; an agriculturist.
a kind of plant.
(myth.) Pradyumna, the son of Křṣṇa.
Babhruvāhana, the son of Arjuna.
= ಕಾಷ್ಣ್ರ್ಯ.
the colour of charcoal; black colour.
the tree Shorea talura (= S. robusta, = Vatica robusta) of Dipterocarpaceae family; Indian dammar.
that portion of the leg from the knee to the bottom of the foot; a leg.
the end part of the leg, on which a person or animal stands or moves; the foot.
the part of a thing, as a chair, cot, etc. on which the entire structure stands or rests; any of the supports of a piece of furniture; a leg.
a strand of hair made for braiding.

ಕಾಲಂಪಿಡಿ kālam D41210piḍi = ಕಾಲುಹಿಡಿ; ಕಾಲಕಡಗ kāla kaḍaga anything worn around the ankle as an ornament, an anklet; ಕಾಲಕಡೆಯ kāla kaḍeya = ಕಾಲಕಡಗ; ಕಾಲಕಸ kāla kasa someone or something that is regarded as worthless; ಕಾಲಮೇಲೆ ಬೀೞ್ kālamēle bīḷ = ಕಾಲಿಗೆ ಬೀಳು; ಕಾಲವ kālava a man inferior to or placed below another in rank, power, importance, etc.; 2. (in pl.) foot soldiers collectively, esp., that branch of an army consisting of soldiers trained and equipped to fight chiefly on foot; infantry; ಕಾಲಹುಗುಳು kāla huguḷu a boil on the leg or foot.
an artificial water, esp. for irrigation; a canal.
any of the four equal parts of something; a fourth part; a quarter.
opposite to white; of the color of coal or pitch; black.
inflicting or tending to inflict pain, agony, etc.
causing a feeling of horror; terrible; dreadful; frightful; terrifying; ಕಾಲವಾಗು kālavāgu to cease to live; to become dead; to die.

time - a) the system of those sequential relations that any event has to any other, as past, present or future; indefinite and continuous duration regarded as that in which events succeed one another; b) the period between two events or during which something exists, happens or acts; measured or measurable interval; c) any period in the history of man or of the universe, often esp. with reference to a characteristic social structure, set of customs, famous person living then, etc. d) a definite point of time, as indicated by a clock; e) an indefinite period extending into the future; f) a particular period in a day, year; g) an appointed, favourable, proper or convenient time; h) (musc.) relative rapidity of movement; the rate of speed at which a composition or passage is played; tempo.
a period of 12 months (occasionally, 13 months in some calendars); a year.
any of the two fortnights of a lunar month.
cessation of life; death.
Yama, the Death-God.
the suposed agency, that determines the course of events; destiny.
power; strength.
the ending of the universe; universal dissolution.
the colour of coal; the black colour.
Śiva.
11) Viṣṇu.
Brahma.
Śani, corresponding to Saturn, seventh of the nine planets that affect the course of one's life.
the ruler of a state; a king.
the edible fruit of the tree Ziziphus jujuba (= Z. mauritiana); Indian cherry; Indian plum.
(myth.) one of the eight serpents; black cobra.
(myth.) one of the hells where severe punishment for one's sin is awarded.
(myth.) one of the seven tongues (or flames) of fire.
the plant Homalium zeylanicum of Flacourtiaceae family.
(gram.) the time of the action or state of being, as past, present or future, that a verb expresses in a sentence; tense.
the Indian cuckoo.
one who distils and sells spirituous liquor.

ಕಾಲಂಪ್ರತಿ kālamprati = ಕಾಲಕಾಲಕ್ಕೆ; ಕಾಲಕಾಲಕ್ಕೆ kāla kālakke from time to time; at frequent or regular intervals; ಕಾಲ ಕೂಡಿಬರು kāla kūḍi baru (fig.) destiny makes things happen; ಕಾಲಕ್ಕೆ ತಕ್ಕಂತೆ ಕೋಲ ಕಟ್ಟು kālakke takkante kōla kaṭṭu to change one's strategy to suit the context, to get benefits from the situation; ಕಾಲಕ್ಕೆ ತಕ್ಕ ಕೋಲ kālakke takka kōla = ಕಾಲಕ್ಕೆ ತಕ್ಕಂತೆ ಕೋಲ ಕಟ್ಟು; ಕಾಲ ತುಂಬಿಬರು kāla tumbibaru (the end, death) to occur, happen; ಕಾಲ ತುಂಬು kāla tumbu (period, term) to be over; to elapse; 2. (the end, death) to occur; ಕಾಲವನ್ನು ಕೊಲ್ಲು kālavannu kollu to spend time; to kill the time.
the plant Homalium zeylanicum of Flacourtiaceae family.
a column - a) a vertical row or list; b) any of the vertical sections of printed matter that are side by side on a page, separated by a rule or blank space.
= ಕಾಲಂಗೆಯ್.
to know the time.
to understand the appropriateness or favourableness of the opportunity.
(obs.) an outer garment, extending from the waist generally to the ankles, and divided into separate coverings for the legs; pants; trousers.
any of the five jointed sets of bones at the front of the human foot; a toe.
the early part of the day, esp. around dawn; morning.
early in the morning.
to cease to live; to suffer death; to die.
= ಕಾಲಂದುಗೆ.
anything worn around the ankle as an ornament, an anklet.
a small, congenital, dark spot, on the human skin; a mole.
a large, reddish brown, glandular organ in vertebrates, located in the upper abdominal cavity and functioning in the secretion of bile and in essential metabolic processes; the liver.
Śiva, whose throat is black.
a bird of small size belonging to Passeridae family; a house sparrow.
any of various gruiform marsh birds (family Rallidae) with long thin feet and a platelike frontal area on the head, that both swim and wade; a gallinule.
= ಕಾಲಕಂಠ.
a place where a river or other body of water is shallow enough to be crossed by wading; a ford.
a loop formed in a rope, cord, etc. by means of a slipknot for catching, trapping a person or animal by the feet.
cessation of life; death.
(pl.) funeral rites or ceremonies; obsequies.
the time or a stage in one's life (esp. religious life) and the duty or duties prescribed to be done at that time or stage.
a man who is not bound by any religious or social duties that otherwise is particular or mandatory with reference to the stage of the life he is in.
a man who is or thought to be the personification of terror; a death-god like man.
to pass a period of time.
to waste or squander one's time.
to manage to survive with difficulty.
Śiva, who subordinated Yama, the Death-God.
the length of time during or the conditions under which an office, a position, etc. is held; tenure.
a person moving on palms and knees (imitating a horse), carrying a child on the back for amusement.
a deadly poison.
(myth.) a deadly poison churned out of the cosmic ocean, drunk by Śiva, to save the world from it.
(myth.) Śiva, whose throat turned black when he drank the deadly poison that came out while churning the cosmic ocean.
the passing of time.
the order of time in which different events happen or occur.
the passing of time.
a spending of time.
= ಕಾಲಕ್ರಮಣ.
the act or fact or managing to surviving with difficulty.
in course of time; (happening, working, etc.) gradually.
the rythmic measure of a musical composition.
the act or fact of making late, slowing up; a delaying.
a wasting or squandering of time.
a musical treatment of a long, mythological story; a musical discourse.
one who spends or squanders time wastefully.

the largest glandular organ in vertebrate animals, located in the upper or anterior part of the abdomen, which secretes bile, and has an important function in the storage and metabolism of carbohydrates, fats, and proteins, also helps detoxify many poisonous substances that may be ingested; the liver.
a portion of time, either indefinite or relatively long, characterised by certain events, processes, conditions, etc.
the act of measuring time, computing the duration of days, months, years, etc. based on the movement of stars, planets, etc.

the science of the universe in which the movement, duration of appearance or invisibility, and regularity of reappearance of stars, planets, etc. are studied and based on which are computed months, years etc.

chronology - a) the science of measuring time in fixed periods and of dating events and epochs and arranging them in the order of occurrence; b) the arrangement of events, dates, etc. in the order of occurrence.
= ಕಾಲಗಣನ.
either of the two bones of the human leg, between the knee and the ankle; the fibula or tibia.
the slipping or passing of time.
the course of happening of events (that will happen necessarily or supposed to be determined by destiny).
absolute darkness; complete absence of light; pitch-darkness.
the condition of events happened becoming obscure in course of time.
good luck or bad luck supposed to have been caused by the entry of a person in to a house, place, etc.
the influence of time.
the prevalent characteristic social structure, set of customs or general tendency of people, particular to a certain period.
a string or band with little spherical bells attached to it, tied around the ankle by girls, women and dancers.

the incessant lapsing of time; the course of happening of events in a long course of time.
name of a cult or religion (now obs.).

the ability or quality of knowing the happening of events, esp. in future.

a stand or shelf of low height.
a small stool used stand on to reach a thing placed at a height.
the bottom surface of the foot; the sole.
anything one is standing on.
an old unit of linear measure.

the three divisions of the day-time, i.e. the morning, afternoon and evening.
involving past, present and future times; used in all the tenses.
changed in or influenced by, past, present and future times.
a man believed to know the events happened in the past, happening at present, and will happen in future.
the staff of Death; the emblem of Yama, the god of death.
anything that is devastating.
the ruthlessness of the natural course of events or destiny (fig. compared to theall-destroying, long, large and pointed tooth of the personified death).
an instrument for measuring very small intervals of time; a chronoscope.

the end part of the leg, on which a person or animal stands or moves; the foot.
the part of a thing, as a chair, cot, etc. on which the entire structure stands or rests; any of the supports of a piece of furniture; a leg.
a strand of hair made for braiding; ಕಾಲಕಸ kāla k asa someone or something that is regarded as worthless.

ಕಾಲಿಗೆ ಬಿದ್ದು ಕಾಲುಂಗರ ಕಳಚಿಕೊ kālige biddu kālungara kaḷaciko to pretend to be humble in offering one's service to achieve one's aim; ಕಾಲಿಗೆ ಬೀಳು kālige bīḷu to prostrate before another's feet; 2. to seek humbly help from another; ಕಾಲಿಗೆ ಬುದ್ಧಿ ಹೇಳು kālige buddi hēḷu to run away; ಕಾಲಿನ ಮೇಲೆ ಬೀಳು kālina mēle bīḷu = ಕಾಲಿಗೆ ಬೀಳು; ಕಾಲಿನಲ್ಲಿ ಚಕ್ರವಿರು kālinalli cakraviru to have the tendency or habit of roaming continuously; ಕಾಲು ಕಡಿಯುತ್ತಿರು kālu kaḍiyuttiru to be eager to keep oneself roaming 2. to have the urge to quarrel with another; ಕಾಲು ಕೆರೆದುಕೊಂಡು ಬರು kālu keredukoṇḍu baru (fig.) to be longing for quarrelling; ಕಾಲುಗಿಡು kālugiḍu to move uncertainly or unsteadily; to totter; to stumble; to falter; 2. to falter in progressing; ಕಾಲು ನೆಕ್ಕು kālu nekku (derog.) to serve another obsequiously for some favour; ಕಾಲೆಳೆದುಕೊಂಡು ಹೋಗು/ಬರು kaleḷedukoṇḍu hōgu/baru to walk, go or come wearily or labouriously; to trudge; ಕಾಲೇಳದಿರು kālēḷadiru (fig.) to be unable to walk.

(fig.) to be unwilling to walk; to loath to go to; ಕಾಲೊಳಗೆ kāloḷage following closely; ಕಾಲ್ಗಳೆಯಿಸು kālgaḷeyisu to smear on the foot; ಒಂಟಿಕಾಲಿನಲ್ಲಿ ನಿಂತಿರು oṇṭikālinalli nintiru (fig.) to be very eager to go; ತನ್ನ ಕಾಲಮೇಲೆ ತಾನು ನಿಂತುಕೊ tanna kālamēle tānnu nintuko (fig.) to manage one's own affairs (esp. economic affairs) without help; to paddle one's own canoe; ಕಾಲಿನಲ್ಲಿ ತುಳಿದರೆ ಹಾವು ಕಚ್ಚದೆ ಬಿಡದು kālinalli tuḷidare hāvu k accade biḍadu oppression causes rebellion; ಕಾಲಿನಲ್ಲಿ ತೋರಿಸಿದ್ದನ್ನು ತಲೆಯಲ್ಲಿ ಹೊತ್ತುಕೊಂಡು ಮಾಡು kālinalli tōrisiddannu taleyalli hottukoṇḍu māḍu (fig.) to try too hard to please some important; to be more obedient than required.
an artificial waterway, esp. for irrigation; a canal.
any of the four equal parts of a whole (as a thing, work, etc); a fourth part; a quarter.
being one of four equal or approximately equal parts into which anything is or may be divided; quarter.
being equal to only about one fourth of the full measure; quarter.
= ಕಾಲುಂಗುರ.
a small, circular band of metal, usu. of silver, worn by a married woman on the second toe; a toe-ring.
(fig.) to hold another's feet submissively, esp. lacking one's self-respect, for a favour.
a shackle or chain for the feet.
a protective cover for the part from the knee to the foot.
(fig.) the act of marrying; wedding; marriage.
a metal ornament worn around the ankle; an anklet.
a loop formed in a rope, cord, etc. by means of a slipknot for catching, trapping a person or animal by the feet.
to move away from; to go or run away.
an outer garment covering each leg separately and usu. extending from the waist to the ankle; trousers; pants.
a knitted or woven covering for the foot usu. extending above the ankle and sometimes to the knee; a sock.
= ಕಾಲುಕುಪ್ಪುಸ.
(one's legs) to lose strength; to become unable to walk.
to falter and fall down.
to scrap the floor with the toes.
(fig.) to provoke another to enter into a quarrel.
(fig.) to provoke another to enter into a quarrel.
either of a pair of long, thin runners of wood, metal, etc., fastened to the shoes for gliding over snow; a ski.
the horny covering on the feet of a horse; the hoof.
the joint that connects the foot and the leg; the ankle.
a metal ornament worn around the ankle; an anklet.
water with which one's feet are washed.
a religious service of washing the feet of a venerable person.
to take the water with which the feet of a venerable person is washed.
= ಕಾಲುಕಣ್ಣಿ.
a knitted or woven covering for the foot for keeping it warm; foot-muff.

a vehicle consisting of a tubular metal frame mounted on two large, wire-spoked wheels, one behind the other, and equipped with handlebars, a saddlelike seat, and foot pedals for driving forward; a bicycle.
a particular movement in fighting using swords.
infantry - a) (pl.) soldiers trained, armed, and equipped to fight on foot; b) a branch of an army composed of these soldiers.
(correctly, ಕಾಲ ಗುಣ)good or bad luck supposed to have been caused by the entry of a person in to a house, place, etc.
the thin, horny substance growing out at the ends of the toes of people, monkeys, etc.; nail.
to cause another's legs to lose their strength.
to cause to falter and fall down.
= ಕಾಲುಕೆಡು.
an artificial waterway for irrigation; a canal.
the shrub Crotolaria juncea of Papilionaceae family, the bitter leaves of which are used as an emetic in gastric and bilious fevers and cultivated extensively for its fibre; the sun hemp.
the horny covering on the feet of a horse, cow, etc.; the hoof.
the act or an instance of killing by trampling.
to stretch the leg forward.
(fig.) to enter into.
(fig.) to sit (or live) without working hard or anxiety.
ಕಾಲು ಚಾಚಿ ಕುಳಿತಿರು kālu cāci kuḷitiru (fig.) to sit and waste one time without doing anything.
a knitted or woven covering for the foot usu. extending above the ankle and sometimes to the knee; a sock.
a disease of cattle and sheep caused by a bacterium (Sphaerophorus necrophorus) and characterised by death of the tissue in and around the hoofs; the foot-rot.
to slip down or falter while walking.
(fig.) to swerve from the right path; to acquire bad habits.
= ಕಾಲುಜರಸು.
(the leg) to be broken.
to break (another's) leg.
(fig.) to lose one's strength; to become ineffective.
to go or run away from a place.
to hinder one's walking.
a metal ornament worn around the ankle; an anklet.

to wash one's feet.
to wash another's feet.
(fig.) to discharge urine from the body; to micturate; to urinate.
infantry - a) (pl.) soldiers trained, armed, and equipped to fight on foot; b) a branch of an army composed of these soldiers.
a narrow path for use by pedestrians only; a foot-path.
a lamp with a tall base, lighted before an idol.
the act of treading heavily; a trampling.

the dust sitting on the foot or feet.
pain in the stomach or abdomen caused by the falling of the dust from another's feet into one's food.
stomach-ache caused to a child, by the supposed evil look of a person.
a humble servant.
the act of walking; walking.
domestic animals, as cattle, sheep, etc., kept for use.
to lick another's feet.
to serve, without self-respect, another for getting a favour.
a crop fed by an artificial water-way.
a small village adjacent to, and depending on a town; a satallite village.
a member of a contingent of foot-soldiers; a foot-soldier.
a badge of honour or a trinket, in the form of a ring made of metal, grass or rope for the foot.
so high or tall as to reach to the knees.
a board or small platform for supporting the feet, for standing on or entering in (to a vehicle etc.); a footboard.
infantry - a) (pl.) soldiers trained, armed, and equipped to fight on foot; b) a branch of an army composed of these soldiers.
a metal ornament worn around the ankle; an anklet.
an acute, highly contagious viral disease of cloven-footed animals, characterised by fever and by blisters in the mouth and around the hoofs; the foot-and-mouth disease.
a narrow path for use by pedestrians only; a foot-path.
to prostrate before another's feet.
